title: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Holocaust Comments Condemned by Top Republicans
sub_head: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy calls the Georgia GOP representative’s remarks ‘appalling’
body:
WASHINGTON—Top Republicans condemned comments Tuesday from Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R., Ga.) comparing proof of Covid-19 vaccinations to actions taken against Jewish people by Nazi Germany leading up to the Holocaust.
Mrs. Greene, who was stripped of her committee assignments earlier this year over inflammatory comments she made before being elected, sparked new outrage over her comments about vaccination status.
“Vaccinated employees get a vaccination logo just like the Nazi’s forced Jewish people to wear a gold star,” Mrs. Greene said Tuesday morning on Twitter, as she retweeted a story about a grocery chain permitting fully vaccinated employees to not wear a mask and have a vaccination logo on their name badge. “Vaccine passports & mask mandates create discrimination against unvaxxed people who trust their immune systems,” she said.
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R., Calif.) issued a statement Tuesday condemning Mrs. Greene’s comments.
“Marjorie is wrong, and her intentional decision to compare the horrors of the Holocaust with wearing masks is appalling,” Mr. McCarthy said. “Let me be clear: the House Republican Conference condemns this language.”
